did.unittitle: Tom Van Zoeren oral history collection 1860s-2011, 2000-2010
did.abstract: Tom Van Zoeren was a park ranger at Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore. His collection contains oral history interviews relating to the history of the Sleeping Bear Dunes region and other Michigan localities.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Tom Van Zoeren (donor no. 9079) in several accessions beginning in 2001.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Tom Van Zoeren oral history collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Tom Van Zoeren worked as a park ranger at Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore from 1984 to 2005. He conducted oral history interviews with many older residents of the park area.

scopecontent.p: The Van Zoeren collection contains numerous oral history interviews conducted between 1979 and 2010, and also includes copies of scanned photos and other supporting documents. The interviews are available variously on audio cassette tapes, audio compact discs, video DVDs, and online. Transcripts or summaries are found in the collection for many of the interviews. The Van Zoeren collection is organized in two sections by format.

The first section contains analog files and physical media such as CDs and DVDs. This section is arranged in the following series by family interview: Basch/Lanham/Van Zoeren oral history interviews, 1993-2000; George Burfiend oral history interviews, photo collection, and farm tour, 2005-2008; DeKorne family oral history and photographs, 2006; Doan family oral history interview, 2006; Dottie (Ashmore) Lanham oral history and photograph collection, 2003-2008; Alfred and Loraine (Olsen) Mason oral history interview and photo collection, 2001-2004; Leonard Thoreson oral history interview and photos, 2005-2006; and Frederick and Margretha Werner Farm oral history interview and photo collection, 2006-2007. These series contain information related to the families and interviews in the form of text, scanned and printed images, and audio and video recordings.

list.head: Information about selected specific interviews:
list.item: Basch, Laura (Oleson), of the Port Oneida, Mich., area (audio cassettes and online)
Burfiend, George, relating to Burfiend farm and Port Oneida (compact discs, video DVDs, and online)
DeKorne, Jack relating to the family of Boudewyn and Kate DeKorne of Grand Rapids and Glen Lake, Mich. (compact disc and online)
Fargo, Judy Carole and Ruth Ann Doan Jones, relating to the Frank and Alma Doan family of Croswell, Mich. (compact discs and online, filed under Doan family)
Lanham, Dottie, relating to her life and to Burdickville and surrounding area (compact discs and online)
Lanham, John, of Burdickville, Mich. (audio cassettes and online)
Mason, Alfred and Lorraine [referred to as 'Loraine' in some collection materials] (Olsen), relating to their families, the family farms and the Port Oneida community (compact discs and online)
Miller, Charles, relating to the Frederick and Margretha Werner farm in Port Oneida (compact discs, video DVD, and online, filed under Werner)
Stuber, Mary Lou, relating to the Frederick and Margretha Werner farm in Port Oneida. (compact discs and online, filed under Werner)
Thoresen, Leonard, relating to his family, the family farm and the Port Oneida community (compact discs, video DVD, and online)
Thoreson, Leonard, relating to the Frederick and Margretha Werner farm in Port Oneida (video DVD and online, filed under Werner)
Van Noord, Trudy, relating to the family of Boudewyn and Kate DeKorne of Grand Rapids and Glen Lake, Mich. (compact disc and online, filed under DeKorne family)
Van Zoeren, Jay, of Vriesland, Mich., 1948 graduate of the University of Michigan Medical School (audio cassettes and online)

scopecontent.p: Additional files relating to these and other persons were received on a hard drive and are available online.

The second section consists of one series of digitized material, Oral histories, photos, and other historic materials from the Sleeping Bear Dunes region. The digital files were created or assembled by Van Zoeren and were received on an external hard drive. This series is further divided into subseries by type of material: Information on Farms, Families, etc.; Oral History Audio Files; Historic Images; Video Recordings; Genealogies; Census and Cemetery Records; Historic Maps; and Other Resources. Some of the content may be digitized versions of items in the analog portion of the collection.

physdesc.physfacet: digital files, originally on 1 hard drive, USB connection

scopecontent.p: The Information on Farms, Families, etc. subseries (71.3 MB, 1933-2010) contains oral history interview summaries and transcripts as well as correspondence, histories in written forms, and compilations of references to particular farms found in other interviews or documents. Files are arranged geographically by region and area, and then by family or farm.

odd.p: (Documents relating to local and family histories collected related to the Burdickville Area of the Sleeping Bear Dunes Region. Consists mainly of summaries and transcripts of oral history interviews, typically organized by track. Also includes some correspondence and histories in written forms.)

did.unittitle: Holden, Mary Ellen and Margaret interview (summary) undated
Johnson, Sarah and David Holden interview (summary) undated

odd.p: (Documents relating to local and family histories collected related to other areas of the Sleeping Bear Dunes Region, including South Manitou and Bow Lakes. Mainly consists of summaries and transcripts of oral history interviews, typically organized by track. Also includes some correspondence and histories in written forms.)

did.unittitle: Roe, Honora of Maple City interview (summary) 2009

odd.p: (Documents relating to local and family histories collected related to the Port Oneida Area of the Sleeping Bear Dunes Region. Mainly consists of summaries and transcripts of oral history interviews, typically organized by track. Also includes some correspondence and histories in written forms, as well as notes pointing to other oral history interviews for more information about particular farms.)

Burfiend, Peter Farm, note of references

Olsen, Ole Farm information and note of references

Siblings Charles H. Miller, Rose Mary Frederick, and Mary Lou Stuber interview (summary) 2009
Johnny Warner and Gene Warner notes 2008

odd.p: (Documents relating to local and family histories collected related to areas outside of the Sleeping Bear Dunes Region. Mainly consists of summaries and transcripts of oral history interviews, typically organized by track. Also includes some correspondence and histories in written forms.)

did.unittitle: Reflections on My Dad by Tom Van Zoeren, circa 2010
Doan family (Judy Carole Fargo and Ruth Ann Doan Jones) interview (summary) 2006
Port Oneida Fair Oral History Project interview (partial transcript and summary) 2010

odd.p: (Summary and partial transcripts of oral history interviews conducted for the Port Oneida Fair Oral History Project by Tom Van Zoeren in August 2010.)

scopecontent.p: The Oral History Audio Files subseries (35.0 GB, 1976-2010) consists of audio files for oral history interviews, primarily conducted by Tom Van Zoeren. Recordings are arranged geographically by region and area, and then by family or farm. Audio files may be in several formats (original session recordings of the interview or series of interviews, a version divided into tracks, or versions converted to different file formats) and may have been digitized from analog media or born digital.

odd.p: (Audio recordings of oral history interview with John Ashmore conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on May 8, 2010. Focuses on growing up in the Burdickville area in the 1930s and 1940s, life on the farm, etc. Description of recordings based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with Leonard Cotner conducted by Tom Van Zoeren circa 2008. Covers family history as well as stories and aspects of his childhood growing up in the Burdickville area.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with John Crosby conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on September 9, 2009. Focuses on Burdickville area history and the families of the region as well as covering some personal history and background. Description of recordings based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with three members of the DeKorne family conducted by Tom Van Zoeren in 2006 and 2007. Series of interviews conducted with Jack DeKorne from September 8 to October 3, 2006 cover family history generally as well as his own life and background, DeKorne Furniture, and Glen Haven Indians. Interview with Ken Ryskamp conducted on August 31, 2007 covers his life growing up and career, various family members, and the Indian settlement by DH Day Park. Interview with Trudy van Noord conducted on September 19, 2006 covers her life growing up and Glen Lake as well as information on some of her relatives. Description of recordings based on summaries available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with Ellsworth and Lucille Faulman conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on April 6, 2004. Focuses on family and personal history including local businesses, church, etc. Description of recordings based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with Clarissa Kellog Hansen conducted by Dottie Lanham and Lucille Faulman on October 12, 1994. Includes information on her childhood and various incidents related to her life and the Burdickville area. Description of recordings based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with members of the Holden family. Interview with David Holden conducted by Lucille Faulman[?] on December 21, 1976 focuses on family history and the Burdickville area. Interviews with David Holden and Sarah Johnson conducted by Lucille Faulman in the 1980s or 1970s discuss memories of the Old Settlers' Picnic and other topics; combined with and introduction by Lucille Faulman in 1992 for the 100-year anniversary of the picnic. Interview with Mary E. Holden and Margaret Holden includes information on family history; interviewer and date not identified.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with two members of the Lanham family conducted between 2003 and 2010. Interviews with Dottie Lanham conducted on May 24, 2003 by Ruth Roderick and from 2005 to 2008 by Tom Van Zoeren. Discusses growing up during the Depression in the Burdickville area, married life, and other people and relatives living in the area. Interview with Nancy Lanham conducted on January 28, 2009 by Tom Van Zoeren and covers her life growing up as well as family history of her parents and grandparents. Description of recordings based on summaries or transcripts available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with Nolan Trumbull conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on October 1, 2008. Focuses on his life and family history, especially his grandparents. Description of recordings based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with Jeannette Wepking conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on May 13, 2009. Focuses on her family, treatment of Jews in the area, and church. Description of recordings based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with Gene Whitten conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on October 3, 2008 and June 18, 2009. Focuses on his life growing up very poor with his mother and siblings, as well as some time in foster care. Also includes information on his more recent health issues and strokes. Description of recordings based on transcript available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with members of the Bufka family conducted by Tom Van Zoeren and others on April 20, 2004. Includes a group discussion facilitated by Tom Urich, Tom Van Zoeren, and others, an interview with Jerome and John Bufka conducted by Barbara Siepker, and a interview/tour with Jerome Bufka interviewed by Laura Quackenbush. Interviews focus on the Bufka farm in Maple City, Michigan. Description of recordings based on very brief summaries available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with Lowell Chamberlain Cate conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on November 7, 2010. Focuses on his life and postal career as well as family history, including information about his grandparents and great-grandparents. Also some on other people in living in the area such as Nan Helm and John Holden. Description of recordings based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with John Lanham conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on January 27, 2000 and February 10, 2000. Includes information about his childhood, family history, neighbors and other people in the area, and logging. Areas discussed include Bow Lakes and Burdickville. Description of recordings based on summary and transcript available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with Bessie Jane Plowman Musil conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on March 28, 2008. Focuses on personal and family history, such as her schooling and growing up in the 1930s and 1940s, along with information about other people in the area. Description of recordings based on summary and transcript available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

did.unittitle: Roe, Honora of Maple City / Barbara Louise Liljestrand, Maxine Louise Wepking Mikowski, and Helen Louise Mikowski interview 2009

odd.p: (Audio recordings of oral history interview with Barbara Louise Liljestrand, Maxine Louise Wepking Mikowski, and Helen Louise Mikowski conducted by Glen Peterson and Tom Van Zoeren on October 10, 2009. Focuses on the life and work of Honora Roe of Maple City, a female minister. Also includes information on Maxine Mikowski's life and background. Description of recordings based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with members of the Baker family in 1979 and between 2004-2008. Interview with Fred Baker conducted by Ellsworth and Lucille Faulman on February 23, 1979 covers information on his life growing up, family history, and the Port Oneida area. Interview with Ruth Oleson conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on March 22, 2004 covers personal and family history as well as information on various families in the area. Series of interviews conducted with Jack and Lucille Barratt by Tom Van Zoeren from 2004 to 2008 covering information about personal and family history, the Port Oneida area, and life and work on the farm. Description of recordings based on summaries and one transcript available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

did.unittitle: Barratt, Jack and Lucille, series of interviews 2004-2007

odd.p: (Audio recordings of oral history interviews with Laura Basch and Arlene Moody conducted from 1993-1995 and in 2009. Series of interviews with Laura Basch conducted by Tom Van Zoeren from 1993 to 1995 cover her life in the Port Oneida area, including school and work on the farm in her youth and adulthood. Also includes information about food produced, purchased, and consumed, stories of people in the area, etc. Members of the Basch, Oleson, Eckhert, Miller, Anderson, Dechow, Kelderhouse, Thoreson, and other families discussed. Interview with Arlene Moody conducted November 25, 2009 by Tom Van Zoeren discusses Basch family history and information about members of other families in the Port Oneida area such as the Olsen family and Schmidt family. Description of recordings based on summaries and partial transcripts available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with George Burfiend and David Ritter conducted from 2005 to 2007. Series of interviews with George Burfiend conducted by Tom Van Zoeren from 2006 to 2007 focus on personal and family history related to the Burfiend farm and the Port Oneida area. Short conversation with David Ritter conducted on August 12, 2005 focuses on family history, specifically various versions of how William Burfiend and Mary Burfiend died. Description of recordings based on summaries available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with Ed Schmidt and other members of the Schmidt family conducted in 2008 and 2010. Interviews with Ed Schmidt conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on February 28, 2008 and March 5, 2008 focus on family history, including their work and career choices. Interview with Schmidt family members at their reunion conducted on July 24, 2010 by Tom Van Zoeren covers aspects of their family history and that of others in the area. Description of recordings based on summaries and transcript available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with members of the Dechow family conducted from 2007-2009. Interview with Jill Baxter conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on August 17, 2007 focuses on Dechow family history from the mid-nineteenth to twentieth century, including involvement in the Lutheran church. Interview with various members of the Dechow-Shalda family conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on August 7, 2009 and August 9, 2009 focuses on family history background and stories. Interview with Robert Klett conducted by Tom Van Zoeren and Kerry Kelly on September 5, 2008 and September 6, 2008 focuses on family history, especially in relation to details about the farm and raising cows, pigs, chickens, etc. Description of recordings based on summaries available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with members of the Eckerdt family conducted in 2008 and 2010. Interview with Beverly Yvonne Krcek conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on October 6, 2008 focuses on her grandparents, Catherine and Henry Eckerdt, and her childhood on the Eckerdt farm during the late 1920s and most of the 1930s. Catherine Eckerdt served as a midwife for the Port Oneida community. Series of interviews with multiple members of the Eckerdt family cover aspects of the history of the farm and house, as well as more general family history. These 3 interviews were conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on June 9, 2008, September 6, 2008, and August 12, 2010. Description of recordings based on summaries available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with members of the Kelderhouse family from 2007-2010. Interview with Nancy and Margaret Hulka conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on August 11, 2007 focuses on Kelderhouse family history and background. Interview with Charlotte Groesser conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on May 4, 2009 focuses on information about various members of the Kelderhouse family as well as some information about her childhood in Beeman Road and Glen Arbor areas and her work as a school teacher. Interview with Kay Bond conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on November 13, 2010 focuses on Kelderhouse and Farrant family history. Description of content based on summaries and transcript available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with members of the Kelderhouse family in 2006 and 2008. Interview with Leon Kelderhouse conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on February 6, 2006 and March 10, 2006 focuses on family and personal history. Interview with Ruth Lambkin conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on September 30, 2008 focuses on her youth, partly spent in the Port Oneida area, as well family history and her parents in particular. Description of recordings based on summaries available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with Robert Adair and Pat Carstensen [Patricia Ann Miller] in 2009. Interview with Robert Adair conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on May 21, 2009 focuses on Miller family history, particularly various recollections about and from Ellen Miller. Interview with Patricia Ann Miller Cartensen conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on July 1, 2009 focuses on her grandmother, Ellen Miller and her inn, and also includes information about other family members and the Thoresons. Description of recordings based on summaries available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with members of the Olsen family from 2001-2004 and in 2007. Series of interviews with Alfred and Lorraine Mason conducted by Tom Van Zoeren between 2001 and 2004 focus on stories and background about family members and their farm in the Port Oneida area. Interviews with various family members conducted by Heather Koch, Susan Pocklington, and Tom Van Zoeren on August 12, 2007 at a family reunion relate background information and stories about various family members in the Charles and Hattie Olsen family. Description of recordings based on summaries and transcript available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

did.unittitle: Mason, Alfred and Lorraine series of interviews 2001-2004

odd.p: (Audio recordings of oral history interviews with Leonard Thoreson in 2005-2006 and 2009-2010. First series of interviews conducted by Tom Van Zoeren from 2005 to 2006 includes information on various Port Oneida area farms, buildings and property layout, people, and families. Also includes some Thoreson family history. Second series of interviews conducted by Tom Van Zoeren from 2009 to 2010 focuses on describing various farm activities, stories, and other information about living in the area. Description of recordings based on transcripts available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

did.unittitle: Thoreson, Leonard first series of interviews 2005-2006
Thoreson, Leonard second series of interviews 2009-2010
Watkins Cottage, Judith C. Watkins, Katharine Watkins Wylde, and Mary Watkins Crane interview 2005

odd.p: (Audio recordings of oral history interview with Judith C. Watkins, Katharine Watkins Wylde, and Mary Watkins Crane conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on August 19, 2005. Focuses on the history of the areas and families, and Mrs. Ellen Miller in particular. Description of recordings based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews regarding the Frederick Miller family or farm recorded between 2006 and 2009. Interview with Charles H. Miller and Leonard Thoreson conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on April 18, 2008 focuses on work on the farm, with cattle, etc., in the context of touring the barn and describing it. Interviews with Charles H. Miller conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on February 28, 2006 and November 21, 2006 focus on the farm and family members, as well as those of other local Port Oneida area families. Interview with Charles H. Miller, Rose Mary Frederick, and Mary Lou Stuber conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on April 30, 2009 focuses on life growing up on the farm, their parents, and other family history. Series of interviews with Mary Lou Miller Stuber conducted by Tom Van Zoeren in March 2007 focuses on her life growing up in the Port Oneida area, including schooling as well as work on the farm. Description of recordings based on summaries and transcript available in 'Information' series.)

did.unittitle: Miller, Charles H. and Leonard Thoreson Barn Tour interview 2008
Miller siblings (Charles, Mary Rose, and Mary Lou) interview 2009
Doan Family interview (Judy Carole Fargo and Ruth Ann Doan Jones) 2006

odd.p: (Audio recordings of oral history interview with Judy Carole Fargo and Ruth Ann Doan Jones conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on October 8, 2006. Focuses on Doan family history and the family farm in Croswell, Michigan. Description of recordings based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interview with Albert Gallup. Discusses family history and growing up in Ann Arbor beginning around the 1930s. Also covers military service during the war and his career in education, for example, starting Huron High School.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with members of the Scott family in 2006 and 2007. Interview with Peggy Scott McCreight conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on November 21, 2006 focuses on Scott family history. Interview with Dorothy Scott Patton conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on November 21, 2006 focuses on personal and family history, including work during World War II. Interview with Alice Elizabeth Scott Bahls conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on February 6, 2007 focuses on personal and family life including attending the University of Michigan and responses to World War II. Description of recordings based on summaries available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Audio recordings of oral history interviews with Carolyn Van Zoeren and Jay Van Zoeren in 1995, 1996, and 2009. Interview with Carolyn Van Zoeren conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on July 29, 2009 focuses on family history and her life from childhood to adulthood. Interviews with Jay Van Zoeren conducted by Tom Van Zoeren from February 1995 to June 1996 focus on family history and farming operations, as well as his education, medical training, and courting Betty DeKorne. Description of recordings based on summaries available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

did.unittitle: Port Oneida Fair Oral History Project interviews 2010

odd.p: (Audio recordings of oral history interviews with various Port Oneida Fair attendees conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on August 13, 2010. Recollections related to personal and family history. Description of recordings based on summary and partial transcript available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

scopecontent.p: The Historic Images subseries (7.7 GB, 1860s-2010s) includes images of photographs and postcards as well as documents such as newspaper clippings and marriage or baptismal certificates. Photographs and postcards depict individuals and groups, structures, animals, the land, and other subjects such as ships and trains related to the history of the region and its inhabitants. The original items date from the mid-nineteenth century through the early twenty-first with the bulk dating from the first half of the twentieth century. Images are arranged geographically by region and area, and then by family, farm, or subject. In some cases both original and edited versions of images are included.

odd.p: (Images of photographs as well as some newspaper clippings and typewritten or handwritten notes related to the Burdickville area. Photographs of individuals and groups, structures, animals, and the land. Original items date from the late nineteenth century through the late twentieth or early twenty-first; bulk from the first half of the twentieth century.)

did.unittitle: Burdickville Miscellaneous, including 'Top of the World'

odd.p: (Images of photographs and postcards relating to the Empire area, including logging and the mill, as well as transportation by ship and train.)
(Images of photographs and postcards relating to the Glen Haven area including dock and inn workers as well as the inn itself and a locomotive.)
(One image of a photograph showing the road to the Narrows, undated.)

did.unittitle: National Park Service (NPS) File Photos, circa 1970s-1980s, 1989

odd.p: (Images of photographs from the National Park Service files of buildings and structures such as houses and barns in the Sleeping Bear Dunes region. Most images undated, circa 1970s and 1980s.)

did.unittitle: North Manitou Island, Musil collection, circa 1915

odd.p: (Images of a photograph of workers at the North Manitou Stormer lumber camp, circa 1915.)

(Images of photographs and postcards as well as baptismal and marriage certificates, pages from a family bible, letters, newspaper clippings, and typewritten or handwritten notes and other documents related to the history of Port Oneida area and the families that inhabited it. Photographs of individuals and groups, structures, animals, and the land. Original items date from the mid-nineteenth century through the early twenty-first; bulk from the first half of the twentieth century.)

did.unittitle: Basch, Martin Farm, Jerry Basch Collection
Alice Van Zoeren Nic Basch Farm
Tom Van Zoeren Nic Basch Farm Photos
Alice Van Zoeren Dechow Farm Photos
Alice Van Zoeren Eckerdt Henry Farm Photos

North Unity School, Laura Basch Collection

Warner, August Farm, Tom Van Zoeren Photos
Tom Van Zoeren Weaver Farm Photos
A Van Zoeren Werner Frederick Farm Photos
Grace Dickinson Werner Fred Farm Photos
Tom Van Zoeren Werner Fred Farm Photos

odd.p: (Images of photographs as well as some newspaper clippings and typewritten or handwritten notes related to other areas in the Sleeping Bear Dunes region. Photographs of individuals and groups, structures, boats and ships. Original items date from the late nineteenth century through the late twentieth or early twenty-first; bulk from the first half of the twentieth century.)

did.unittitle: Farming in Leelanau but not on island

odd.p: (Images of photographs a showing the act of 'bucking ice' with a boat, the South Manitou village area, and the South Manitou Island school with Mr. Sheridan. From 1925, 1938, and undated.)

(Images of photographs from families outside the Sleeping Bear Dunes region: the Doan family, Scott family, and Van Zoeren family. Photographs of individuals and groups of people; many portraits. Original items date from the mid-nineteenth century through the mid-twentieth; bulk from the early twentieth century.)

scopecontent.p: The Video Recordings subseries (13.7 GB, 1995-2010) contains oral history interviews in video formats, often in the context of a tour of a particular area or farm, as well as videos of various historic sites in the Port Oneida area. Files are arranged by interviewee or topic.

odd.p: (Video recordings of sites on Port Oneida area farms, such as the remains of the Burfiend Sugar Shack or the George Olsen boulder pile. Videos narrated by Tom Van Zoeren.)

(Video of oral history interview with Jack Barratt on sites in the Port Oneida area conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on April 18, 2005. Sites visited include the Mary and Ellie Miller Farmstead, the Old Dock, and the Burfiend Farm and Barn. Discusses family and local area history; explains the use of various tools and mechanisms. Description of video based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Video of oral history interview with Laura Basch on sites in the Port Oneida area conducted by Tom Van Zoeren from January 13, 1995 to March 12, 1995. Discusses and explains the history of various farms, structures, plants/trees, etc., as well as personal and family history. Description of video based on summary available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series.)

(Video of oral history interview with Laura Basch centered around items and photographs from her home conducted by Tom Van Zoeren from January 20, 1995 to April 12, 1995. Describes the context of items and photographs as well as identifying people in the images. Focuses on personal and family history and other families in the Port Oneida area. Description of video based on transcript available in 'Information on Farms, Families, etc.' series and selected review of the video files.)

(Video of oral history interview with Lorraine Mason conducted by Susan Pocklington in August 2007 focusing on the Charles and Hattie Olsen house where Lorraine Mason grew up and especially the arrangement of the kitchen. Some information about her parents, Charles and Hattie as well.)

(Video of a series of brief interviews with members of the Olsen family at the family reunion conducted by Alice Van Zoeren and Susan Pocklington in August 2007. Some interviews are simple introductions and others share memories of the house and visiting the area as children.)

(Video of oral history interview with Leonard Thoreson on farms in the Port Oneida area conducted by Tom Van Zoeren with Kerry Kelly on April 5, 2005. Sites visited include the Everett Olsen farm, Henry and Ernie Anderson farm, Charles Miller farm, and others. Focuses on describing various buildings and landscape features that existed on the farms, with some stories of local families as well.)

(Video of oral history interview with Leonard Thoreson conducted by Tom Van Zoeren on August 4, 2006. Tours the Thoreson house and farm and explains the context of various rooms, buildings, and features of the site.)

(Genealogical charts for Port Oneida area families, as well as the DeKorne family. Includes both genealogy software files in GenoPro and GEDCOM formats as well as family trees exported as PDF files. Families names include Baker, Basch, Brunson, Burfiend, Dechow, Eckerdt, Kelderhouse, Miller, Olsen, Prause, Schmidt, Thoreson, and Werner.)

scopecontent.p: The Genealogies subseries (1.6 GB, 2009-2010) consists of genealogical charts for Port Oneida area families and the DeKorne family. It includes both genealogy software files in GenoPro and GEDCOM formats as well as family trees exported from the software as PDF files.

did.unittitle: DeKorne family genealogy files and family tree
Port Oneida families genealogy files and family trees

odd.p: (Image of 1920 Census record for the Glen Arbor township; spreadsheet and PDF listing cemetery record information for the Maple Grove Cemetery and the St. Philip Neri Cemetery in Empire.)

scopecontent.p: The Census and Cemetery Records subseries (19.9 MB, 1920 and 2006) contains an image of 1920 Census record for the Glen Arbor township and cemetery record information for the Maple Grove Cemetery and the St. Philip Neri Cemetery in Empire.

did.unittitle: Image of census record for Glen Arbor Township 1920
Lists of cemetery record information for Maple Grove Cemetery and St. Philip Neri Cemetery in Empire 2006

odd.p: (Images of maps showing Leelanau County, Glen Arbor, the Port Oneida area, etc. Scanned images of plat maps from 1881, 1961, and 1920, as well as a 2009 map by Tom Van Zoeren showing farms and other key features of the area.)

scopecontent.p: The Historic Maps subseries (101 MB, 1881-2009) includes images of maps showing Leelanau County, Glen Arbor, the Port Oneida area, etc.
The Other Resources subseries (37.4 MB, 1995 and 2007-2011) contains collected written and compiled resources on the Sleeping Bear Dunes region, and in particular the Port Oneida area.

odd.p: (Document explaining the digital content of the collection as originally stored on an external hard drive. Written by Tom Van Zoeren in 2011.)

(Collected written and compiled resources on the Sleeping Bear Dunes region, and in particular the Port Oneida area. Includes the National Park Service's 'Cultural Landscapes Inventory of the Port Oneida Rural Historic District, Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore' from 2007, 'Farming at the Water's Edge: An Assessment of Agricultural and Cultural Landscape Resources in the Proposed Port Oneida Rural Historic District at Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore, Michigan' by Marla J. McEnaney, William H. Tishler, and Arnold R. Alanen from 1995, as well as additional notes, corrections, and other documents.)
